teams.blurb: Founded in 2005 and helmed by Christian Horner, Red Bull Racing has been a relentless force in Formula 1. Racing under an Austrian license but rooted in the UK, it stands as a pivotal part of Red Bull GmbH alongside Scuderia AlphaTauri. From Cosworth and Ferrari to a fruitful alliance with Renault, the team's pinnacle arrived from 2010 to 2013, clinching four consecutive Drivers' and Constructors' Championships, marking them as the first Austrian team to achieve such a feat.

The Mercedes-AMG Petronas Formula One Team stands as an emblem of motorsport excellence, etching its name in the annals of Formula 1 history. Renowned for their dominance in the 2010s, securing multiple Constructors' Championships, Mercedes' legacy is defined by an unwavering commitment to precision engineering and performance. Led by visionary minds, their pursuit of innovation and speed has propelled them to the forefront of the sport.

Embodying the essence of motorsport passion and pedigree, the Scuderia Ferrari Formula One Team stands as an indelible icon in racing history. With a legacy spanning decades, Ferrari has become synonymous with Formula 1, crafting a narrative of relentless pursuit, innovation, and unrivaled passion for the sport. From the roaring engines of the past to the cutting-edge technology of today, Ferrari's journey through the annals of Formula 1 remains a testament to racing excellence.

McLaren Racing, one of the most illustrious names in Formula One history, was established by New Zealand racer Bruce McLaren in the 1960s. Renowned for its relentless pursuit of excellence, McLaren has a rich legacy in F1, boasting multiple Constructors' and Drivers' Championships. The team has seen legendary drivers like Ayrton Senna, Alain Prost, and Lewis Hamilton contribute to its success. Despite facing transitional phases in recent years, McLaren's resilience, technological innovation, and passionate fanbase continue to propel them forward, symbolizing a commitment to pushing boundaries in motorsport.

Alfa Romeo Racing ORLEN, a distinguished name in Formula 1, boasts a rich history intertwined with the sport's evolution. Established as a pillar of motorsport, the team's legacy spans decades, embodying a blend of tradition, innovation, and unwavering dedication to racing excellence. From its early days to the present, Alfa Romeo Racing ORLEN has remained a formidable presence on the grid, showcasing resilience and a commitment to pushing the boundaries of technology and performance in the ever-evolving world of Formula 1.

Alpine, a French racing team in Formula One, has roots dating back to the foundation of the Alpine brand in the 1950s by Jean Rédélé. While initially focused on rallying and endurance racing, Alpine ventured into Formula One as a constructor and has a rich history intertwined with motorsport. The team, formerly known as Renault, transitioned to the Alpine name in 2021, marking a new chapter while maintaining the Renault Group's heritage. Alpine embodies a blend of French flair and technical expertise, aiming to leverage their racing pedigree and innovative spirit to thrive in the competitive world of Formula One.

The Williams Formula One team, founded by Sir Frank Williams and Sir Patrick Head in 1977, has a storied history in motorsport. With a legacy of success, including seven Constructors' Championships and nine Drivers' Championships, the team has seen iconic drivers like Ayrton Senna and Nigel Mansell grace its ranks. Despite facing challenges in recent years, Williams remains a symbol of determination, resilience, and a commitment to the pursuit of excellence in Formula 1.

AlphaTauri, formerly known as Toro Rosso, has carved its niche as an integral part of Formula 1's landscape. As the sister team to Red Bull Racing, it plays a crucial role in the Red Bull development track, showcasing a fusion of ambition, technological innovation, and nurturing emerging talent. Evolving from its origins, the team stands as a testament to perseverance, adaptability, and a relentless pursuit of success on the track. With a history rooted in the sport's competitive spirit, AlphaTauri embodies a commitment to fostering a legacy of spirited racing, cementing its position as a pivotal entity in the Formula 1 fraternity.

Alfa Romeo Racing ORLEN, a distinguished name in Formula 1, boasts a rich history intertwined with the sport's evolution. Established as a pillar of motorsport, the team's legacy spans decades, embodying a blend of tradition, innovation, and unwavering dedication to racing excellence. From its early days to the present, Alfa Romeo Racing ORLEN has remained a formidable presence on the grid, showcasing resilience and a commitment to pushing the boundaries of technology and performance in the ever-evolving world of Formula 1.

Haas F1 Team entered Formula One in 2016, founded by Gene Haas, a successful American businessman and the founder of Haas Automation. The team made a notable impact, bringing an American presence back to the pinnacle of motorsport after a long absence. While their early years showed promise with solid performances, Haas faced various challenges in the intensely competitive field. The team's commitment to growing and learning in F1 reflects their ambition to establish a strong foothold and compete at the highest level of international racing.
